telefonicaopencloud-datasource-dns-zone-.body:
data "telefonicaopencloud_dns_zone_v2" "$1" {
    # region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 DNS client. A DNS client is needed to retrieve zone ids. If omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used.
    region = ""

    # name - (Optional) The name of the zone.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) A description of the zone.
    description = ""

    # email - (Optional) The email contact for the zone record.
    email = ""

    # status - (Optional) The zone's status.
    status = ""

    # ttl - (Optional) The time to live (TTL) of the zone.
    ttl = ""

    # type - (Optional) The type of the zone. Can either be `PRIMARY` or `SECONDARY`.
    type = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" is set to the ID of the found zone. In addition, the following attributes
are exported:
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "type" - (Optional) The type of the zone. Can either be "PRIMARY" or "SECONDARY".
    # "name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "type" - (Optional) The type of the zone. Can either be "PRIMARY" or "SECONDARY".
    # "email" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "type" - (Optional) The type of the zone. Can either be "PRIMARY" or "SECONDARY".
    # "type" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "type" - (Optional) The type of the zone. Can either be "PRIMARY" or "SECONDARY".
    # "ttl" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "type" - (Optional) The type of the zone. Can either be "PRIMARY" or "SECONDARY".
    # "description" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "type" - (Optional) The type of the zone. Can either be "PRIMARY" or "SECONDARY".
    # "status" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "type" - (Optional) The type of the zone. Can either be "PRIMARY" or "SECONDARY".
    # "attributes" - Attributes of the DNS Service scheduler.
    # "type" - (Optional) The type of the zone. Can either be "PRIMARY" or "SECONDARY".
    # "masters" - An array of master DNS servers. When "type" is  "SECONDARY".
    # "type" - (Optional) The type of the zone. Can either be "PRIMARY" or "SECONDARY".
    # "created_at" - The time the zone was created.
    # "type" - (Optional) The type of the zone. Can either be "PRIMARY" or "SECONDARY".
    # "updated_at" - The time the zone was last updated.
    # "type" - (Optional) The type of the zone. Can either be "PRIMARY" or "SECONDARY".
    # "transferred_at" - The time the zone was transferred.
    # "type" - (Optional) The type of the zone. Can either be "PRIMARY" or "SECONDARY".
    # "version" - The version of the zone.
    # "type" - (Optional) The type of the zone. Can either be "PRIMARY" or "SECONDARY".
    # "serial" - The serial number of the zone.
    # "type" - (Optional) The type of the zone. Can either be "PRIMARY" or "SECONDARY".
    # "pool_id" - The ID of the pool hosting the zone.
    # "type" - (Optional) The type of the zone. Can either be "PRIMARY" or "SECONDARY".
    # "project_id" - The project ID that owns the zone.
    # "type" - (Optional) The type of the zone. Can either be "PRIMARY" or "SECONDARY".
}
telefonicaopencloud-datasource-dns-zone-.description: Use this data source to get the ID of an available TelefonicaOpenCloud DNS zone.

telefonicaopencloud-datasource-s3-bucket.body:
data "telefonicaopencloud_s3_bucket_object" "$1" {
    # key - (Required) The full path to the object inside the bucket
    key = ""

    # bucket - (Required) The name of the bucket to read the object from
    bucket = ""

    # version_id - (Optional) Specific version ID of the object returned (defaults to latest version)
    version_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "body" - Object data (see **limitations above** to understand cases in which this field is actually available)
    # "cache_control" - Specifies caching behavior along the request/reply chain.
    # "content_disposition" - Specifies presentational information for the object.
    # "content_encoding" - Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object and thus what decoding mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type referenced by the Content-Type header field.
    # "content_language" - The language the content is in.
    # "content_length" - Size of the body in bytes.
    # "content_type" - A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data.
    # "etag" - [ETag](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_ETag) generated for the object (an MD5 sum of the object content in case it's not encrypted)
    # "expiration" - If the object expiration is configured (see [object lifecycle management](http://docs.telefonicaopencloud.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/object-lifecycle-mgmt.html)), the field includes this header. It includes the expiry-date and rule-id key value pairs providing object expiration information. The value of the rule-id is URL encoded.
    # "expires" - The date and time at which the object is no longer cacheable.
    # "last_modified" - Last modified date of the object in RFC1123 format (e.g. "Mon, 02 Jan 2006 15:04:05 MST")
    # "metadata" - A map of metadata stored with the object in S3
    # "server_side_encryption" - If the object is stored using server-side encryption (KMS or Amazon S3-managed encryption key), this field includes the chosen encryption and algorithm used.
    # "sse_kms_key_id" - If present, specifies the ID of the Key Management Service (KMS) master encryption key that was used for the object.
    # "storage_class" - [Storage class](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/storage-class-intro.html) information of the object. Available for all objects except for "Standard" storage class objects.
    # "version_id" - The latest version ID of the object returned.
    # "website_redirect_location" - If the bucket is configured as a website, redirects requests for this object to another object in the same bucket or to an external URL. Amazon S3 stores the value of this header in the object metadata.
    # "tags"  - A mapping of tags assigned to the object.
}
telefonicaopencloud-datasource-s3-bucket.description:
The S3 object data source allows access to the metadata and
_optionally_ (see below) content of an object stored inside S3 bucket. ~> **Note:** The content of an object (`body` field) is available only for objects which have a human-readable `Content-Type` (`text/*` and `application/json`). This is to prevent printing unsafe characters and potentially downloading large amount of data which would be thrown away in favour of metadata.

telefonicaopencloud-resource-as-configur.body:
resource "telefonicaopencloud_as_configuration_v1" "$1" {
    # charging_mode - (Required) The bandwidth charging mode. The system only supports `traffic`.
    charging_mode = ""

    # share_type - (Required) The bandwidth sharing type. The system only supports `PER` (indicates exclusive bandwidth).
    share_type = ""

    # size - (Required) The bandwidth (Mbit/s). The value range is 1 to 300.
    size = ""

    # bandwidth - (Required) The bandwidth information. The structure is described below.
    bandwidth = ""

    # ip_type - (Required) The IP address type. The system only supports `5_bgp` (indicates dynamic BGP).
    ip_type = ""

    # contents - (Required) The content of the injected file, which must be encoded with base64.
    contents = ""

    # eip - (Required) The configuration parameter for creating an elastic IP address
    eip = ""

    # contents - (Required) The content of the injected file, which must be encoded with base64.
    contents = ""

    # path - (Required) The absolute path of the destination file.
    path = ""

    # disk_type - (Required) Whether the disk is a system disk or a data disk. Option `DATA` indicates   a data disk. option `SYS` indicates a system disk.
    disk_type = ""

    # volume_type - (Required) The disk type, which must be the same as the disk type available in the system.   The options include `SATA` (common I/O disk type) and `SSD` (ultra-high I/O disk type).
    volume_type = ""

    # size - (Required) The disk size. The unit is GB. The system disk size ranges from 40 to 32768,   and the data disk size ranges from 10 to 32768.
    size = ""

    # key_name - (Required) The name of the SSH key pair used to log in to the instance.
    key_name = ""

    # instance_config - (Required) The information about instance configurations. The instance_config   dictionary data structure is documented below.
    instance_config = ""

    # scaling_configuration_name - (Required) The name of the AS configuration. The name can contain letters,   digits, underscores(_), and hyphens(-), and cannot exceed 64 characters.
    scaling_configuration_name = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to create the AS configuration. If   omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this   creates a new AS configuration.
    region = ""

    # instance_id - (Optional) When using the existing instance specifications as the template to   create AS configurations, specify this argument. In this case, flavor, image,   and disk arguments do not take effect. If the instance_id argument is not specified,   flavor, image, and disk arguments are mandatory.
    instance_id = ""

    # flavor - (Optional) The flavor ID.
    flavor = ""

    # image - (Optional) The image ID.
    image = ""

    # disk - (Optional) The disk group information. System disks are mandatory and data disks are optional.   The dick structure is described below.
    disk = ""

    # user_data - (Optional) The user data to provide when launching the instance.   The file content must be encoded with Base64.
    user_data = ""

    # personality - (Optional) Customize the personality of an instance by   defining one or more files and their contents. The personality structure   is described below.
    personality = ""

    # public_ip - (Optional) The elastic IP address of the instance. The public_ip structure   is described below.
    public_ip = ""

    # metadata - (Optional) Metadata key/value pairs to make available from   within the instance.
    metadata = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
telefonicaopencloud-resource-as-configur.description: Manages a V1 AS Configuration resource within TelefonicaOpenCloud.

telefonicaopencloud-resource-as-group-v1.body:
resource "telefonicaopencloud_as_group_v1" "$1" {
    # id - (Required) The UUID of the security group.
    id = ""

    # id - (Required) The network UUID.
    id = ""

    # vpc_id - (Required) The VPC ID. Changing this creates a new group.
    vpc_id = ""

    # security_groups - (Required) An array of one or more security group IDs   to associate with the group. The security_groups object structure is   documented below.
    security_groups = ""

    # networks - (Required) An array of one or more network IDs.   The system supports up to five networks. The networks object structure   is documented below.
    networks = ""

    # scaling_group_name - (Required) The name of the scaling group. The name can contain letters,   digits, underscores(_), and hyphens(-),and cannot exceed 64 characters.
    scaling_group_name = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to create the AS group. If   omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this   creates a new AS group.
    region = ""

    # scaling_configuration_id - (Optional) The configuration ID which defines   configurations of instances in the AS group.
    scaling_configuration_id = ""

    # desire_instance_number - (Optional) The expected number of instances. The default   value is the minimum number of instances. The value ranges from the minimum number of   instances to the maximum number of instances.
    desire_instance_number = ""

    # min_instance_number - (Optional) The minimum number of instances.   The default value is 0.
    min_instance_number = ""

    # max_instance_number - (Optional) The maximum number of instances.   The default value is 0.
    max_instance_number = ""

    # cool_down_time - (Optional) The cooling duration (in seconds). The value ranges   from 0 to 86400, and is 900 by default.
    cool_down_time = ""

    # lb_listener_id - (Optional) The ELB listener IDs. The system supports up to   three ELB listeners, the IDs of which are separated using a comma (,).
    lb_listener_id = ""

    # available_zones - (Optional) The availability zones in which to create   the instances in the autoscaling group.
    available_zones = ""

    # health_periodic_audit_method - (Optional) The health check method for instances   in the AS group. The health check methods include `ELB_AUDIT` and `NOVA_AUDIT`.   If load balancing is configured, the default value of this parameter is `ELB_AUDIT`.   Otherwise, the default value is `NOVA_AUDIT`.
    health_periodic_audit_method = ""

    # health_periodic_audit_time - (Optional) The health check period for instances.   The period has four options: 5 minutes (default), 15 minutes, 60 minutes, and 180 minutes.
    health_periodic_audit_time = ""

    # instance_terminate_policy - (Optional) The instance removal policy. The policy has   four options: `OLD_CONFIG_OLD_INSTANCE` (default), `OLD_CONFIG_NEW_INSTANCE`,   `OLD_INSTANCE`, and `NEW_INSTANCE`.
    instance_terminate_policy = ""

    # notifications - (Optional) The notification mode. The system only supports `EMAIL`   mode which refers to notification by email.
    notifications = ""

    # delete_publicip - (Optional) Whether to delete the elastic IP address bound to the   instances of AS group when deleting the instances. The options are `true` and `false`.
    delete_publicip = ""

    # delete_instances - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are `yes` and `no`.
    delete_instances = ""

    # delete_instances - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are `yes` and `no`.
    delete_instances = ""

    # delete_instances - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are `yes` and `no`.
    delete_instances = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "scaling_group_name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "desire_instance_number" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "min_instance_number" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "max_instance_number" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "cool_down_time" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "lb_listener_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "health_periodic_audit_method" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "health_periodic_audit_time" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "instance_terminate_policy" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "scaling_configuration_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "delete_publicip" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "notifications" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
    # "instances" - The instances IDs of the AS group.
    # "delete_instances" - (Optional) Whether to delete the instances in the AS group   when deleting the AS group. The options are "yes" and "no".
}
telefonicaopencloud-resource-as-group-v1.description: Manages a V1 Autoscaling Group resource within TelefonicaOpenCloud.

telefonicaopencloud-resource-as-policy-v.body:
resource "telefonicaopencloud_as_policy_v1" "$1" {
    # launch_time - (Required) The time when the scaling action is triggered. If `scaling_policy_type`   is set to `SCHEDULED`, the time format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmZ. If `scaling_policy_type` is set to   `RECURRENCE`, the time format is hh:mm.
    launch_time = ""

    # scaling_policy_type - (Required) The AS policy type. The values can be `ALARM`, `SCHEDULED`,   and `RECURRENCE`.
    scaling_policy_type = ""

    # scaling_group_id - (Required) The AS group ID. Changing this creates a new AS policy.
    scaling_group_id = ""

    # scaling_policy_name - (Required) The name of the AS policy. The name can contain letters,   digits, underscores(_), and hyphens(-),and cannot exceed 64 characters.
    scaling_policy_name = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to create the AS policy. If   omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this   creates a new AS policy.
    region = ""

    # alarm_id - (Optional) The alarm rule ID. This argument is mandatory   when `scaling_policy_type` is set to `ALARM`.
    alarm_id = ""

    # scheduled_policy - (Optional) The periodic or scheduled AS policy. This argument is mandatory   when `scaling_policy_type` is set to `SCHEDULED` or `RECURRENCE`. The scheduled_policy structure   is documented below.
    scheduled_policy = ""

    # scaling_policy_action - (Optional) The action of the AS policy. The scaling_policy_action   structure is documented below.
    scaling_policy_action = ""

    # cool_down_time - (Optional) The cooling duration (in seconds), and is 900 by default.
    cool_down_time = ""

    # recurrence_type - (Optional) The periodic triggering type. This argument is mandatory when   `scaling_policy_type` is set to `RECURRENCE`. The options include `Daily`, `Weekly`, and `Monthly`.
    recurrence_type = ""

    # recurrence_value - (Optional) The frequency at which scaling actions are triggered.
    recurrence_value = ""

    # start_time - (Optional) The start time of the scaling action triggered periodically.   The time format complies with UTC. The current time is used by default. The time   format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmZ.
    start_time = ""

    # end_time - (Optional) The end time of the scaling action triggered periodically.   The time format complies with UTC. This argument is mandatory when `scaling_policy_type`   is set to `RECURRENCE`. The time format is YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmZ.
    end_time = ""

    # operation - (Optional) The operation to be performed. The options include `ADD` (default), `REMOVE`,   and `SET`.
    operation = ""

    # instance_number - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
    instance_number = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "instance_number" - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
    # "scaling_policy_name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "instance_number" - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
    # "scaling_policy_type" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "instance_number" - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
    # "alarm_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "instance_number" - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
    # "cool_down_time" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "instance_number" - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
    # "scaling_policy_action/operation" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "instance_number" - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
    # "scaling_policy_action/instance_number" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "instance_number" - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
    # "scheduled_policy/launch_time" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "instance_number" - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
    # "scheduled_policy/recurrence_type" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "instance_number" - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
    # "scheduled_policy/recurrence_value" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "instance_number" - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
    # "scheduled_policy/start_time" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "instance_number" - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
    # "scheduled_policy/end_time" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "instance_number" - (Optional) The number of instances to be operated. The default number is 1.
}
telefonicaopencloud-resource-as-policy-v.description: Manages a V1 AS Policy resource within TelefonicaOpenCloud.

telefonicaopencloud-resource-blockstorag.body:
resource "telefonicaopencloud_blockstorage_volume_v2" "$1" {
    # size - (Required) The size of the volume to create (in gigabytes). Changing   this creates a new volume.
    size = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to create the volume. If   omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this   creates a new volume.
    region = ""

    # availability_zone - (Optional) The availability zone for the volume.   Changing this creates a new volume.
    availability_zone = ""

    # consistency_group_id - (Optional) The consistency group to place the volume   in.
    consistency_group_id = ""

    # description - (Optional) A description of the volume. Changing this updates   the volume's description.
    description = ""

    # image_id - (Optional) The image ID from which to create the volume.   Changing this creates a new volume.
    image_id = ""

    # metadata - (Optional) Metadata key/value pairs to associate with the volume.   Changing this updates the existing volume metadata.
    metadata = ""

    # name - (Optional) A unique name for the volume. Changing this updates the   volume's name.
    name = ""

    # snapshot_id - (Optional) The snapshot ID from which to create the volume.   Changing this creates a new volume.
    snapshot_id = ""

    # source_replica - (Optional) The volume ID to replicate with.
    source_replica = ""

    # source_vol_id - (Optional) The volume ID from which to create the volume.   Changing this creates a new volume.
    source_vol_id = ""

    # volume_type - (Optional) The type of volume to create.   Changing this creates a new volume.

resource "telefonicaopencloud_ces_alarmrule" "$1" {
    # count - (Required) Specifies the number of consecutive occurrence times.   The value ranges from 1 to 5.
    count = ""

    # value - (Required) Specifies the alarm threshold. The value ranges from   0 to Number of 1.7976931348623157e+308.
    value = ""

    # comparison_operator - (Required) Specifies the comparison condition of alarm   thresholds. The value can be >, =, <, >=, or <=.
    comparison_operator = ""

    # filter - (Required) Specifies the data rollup methods. The value can be   max, min, average, sum, and vaiance.
    filter = ""

    # period - (Required) Specifies the alarm checking period in seconds. The   value can be 1, 300, 1200, 3600, 14400, and 86400.   Note: If period is set to 1, the raw metric data is used to determine   whether to generate an alarm.
    period = ""

    # value - (Required) Specifies the dimension value. The value can be a string   of 1 to 64 characters that must start with a letter or a number and can consists   of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, underscores (_), or hyphens   (-).
    value = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the dimension name. The value can be a string   of 1 to 32 characters that must start with a letter and can consists of uppercase   letters, lowercase letters, numbers, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).
    name = ""

    # dimensions - (Required) Specifies the list of metric dimensions. Currently,   the maximum length of the dimesion list that are supported is 3. The structure   is described below.
    dimensions = ""

    # metric_name - (Required) Specifies the metric name. The value can be a string   of 1 to 64 characters that must start with a letter and can consists of uppercase   letters, lowercase letters, numbers, or underscores (_).
    metric_name = ""

    # namespace - (Required) Specifies the namespace in service.item format. service.item   can be a string of 3 to 32 characters that must start with a letter and can   consists of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, or underscores (_).
    namespace = ""

    # condition - (Required) Specifies the alarm triggering condition. The structure   is described below.
    condition = ""

    # metric - (Required) Specifies the alarm metrics. The structure is described   below.
    metric = ""

    # alarm_name - (Required) Specifies the name of an alarm rule. The value can   be a string of 1 to 128 characters that can consist of numbers, lowercase letters,   uppercase letters, underscores (_), or hyphens (-).
    alarm_name = ""

    # alarm_description - (Optional) The value can be a string of 0 to 256 characters.
    alarm_description = ""

    # alarm_actions - (Optional) Specifies the action triggered by an alarm. The   structure is described below.
    alarm_actions = ""

    # insufficientdata_actions - (Optional) Specifies the action triggered by   data insufficiency. The structure is described below.
    insufficientdata_actions = ""

    # ok_actions - (Optional) Specifies the action triggered by the clearing of   an alarm. The structure is described below.
    ok_actions = ""

    # alarm_enabled - (Optional) Specifies whether to enable the alarm. The default   value is true.
    alarm_enabled = ""

    # alarm_action_enabled - (Optional) Specifies whether to enable the action   to be triggered by an alarm. The default value is true.   Note: If alarm_action_enabled is set to true, at least one of the following   parameters alarm_actions, insufficientdata_actions, and ok_actions cannot   be empty. If alarm_actions, insufficientdata_actions, and ok_actions coexist,   their corresponding notification_list must be of the same value.
    alarm_action_enabled = ""

    # unit - (Optional) Specifies the data unit.
    unit = ""

    # type - (Optional) specifies the type of action triggered by an alarm. the   value can be notification or autoscaling.   notification: indicates that a notification will be sent to the user.   autoscaling: indicates that a scaling action will be triggered.
    type = ""

    # notification_list - (Optional) specifies the topic urn list of the target   notification objects. the maximum length is 5. the topic urn list can be   obtained from simple message notification (smn) and in the following format:   urn: smn:([a-z]|[a-z]|[0-9]|\-){1,32}:([a-z]|[a-z]|[0-9]){32}:([a-z]|[a-z]|[0-9]|\-|\_){1,256}.   if type is set to notification, the value of notification_list cannot be   empty. if type is set to autoscaling, the value of notification_list must   be [] and the value of namespace must be sys.as.   Note: to enable the as alarm rules take effect, you must bind scaling   policies. for details, see the auto scaling api reference.
    notification_list = ""

    # type - (Optional) specifies the type of action triggered by an alarm. the   value is notification.   notification: indicates that a notification will be sent to the user.
    type = ""

    # notification_list - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    notification_list = ""

    # type - (Optional) specifies the type of action triggered by an alarm. the   value is notification.   notification: indicates that a notification will be sent to the user.
    type = ""

    # notification_list - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    notification_list = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "alarm_name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "notification_list" - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    # "alarm_description" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "notification_list" - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    # "metric" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "notification_list" - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    # "condition" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "notification_list" - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    # "alarm_actions" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "notification_list" - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    # "insufficientdata_actions" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "notification_list" - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    # "ok_actions" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "notification_list" - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    # "alarm_enabled" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "notification_list" - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    # "alarm_action_enabled" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "notification_list" - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    # "id" - Specifies the alarm rule ID.
    # "notification_list" - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    # "update_time" - Specifies the time when the alarm status changed. The value
    # "notification_list" - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
    # "alarm_state" - Specifies the alarm status. The value can be:
    # "notification_list" - (Optional) indicates the list of objects to be notified   if the alarm status changes. the maximum length is 5.
}

telefonicaopencloud-resource-compute-flo.description:
Manages a V2 floating IP resource within TelefonicaOpenCloud Nova (compute)
that can be used for compute instances. Please note that managing floating IPs through the TelefonicaOpenCloud Compute API has
been deprecated. Unless you are using an older TelefonicaOpenCloud environment, it is
recommended to use the [`telefonicaopencloud_networking_floatingip_v2`](networking_floatingip_v2.html)
resource instead, which uses the TelefonicaOpenCloud Networking API.

telefonicaopencloud-resource-compute-ins.body:
resource "telefonicaopencloud_compute_instance_v2" "$1" {
    # contents - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    contents = ""

    # file - (Required) The absolute path of the destination file.
    file = ""

    # source_type - (Required) The source type of the device. Must be one of   "blank", "image", "volume", or "snapshot". Changing this creates a new   server.
    source_type = ""

    # name - (Required) A unique name for the resource.
    name = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to create the server instance. If   omitted, the `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this   creates a new server.
    region = ""

    # image_id - (Optional) (Optional; Required if `image_name` is empty and not booting   from a volume. Do not specify if booting from a volume.) The image ID of   the desired image for the server. Changing this creates a new server.
    image_id = ""

    # image_name - (Optional) (Optional; Required if `image_id` is empty and not booting   from a volume. Do not specify if booting from a volume.) The name of the   desired image for the server. Changing this creates a new server.
    image_name = ""

    # flavor_id - (Optional) (Optional; Required if `flavor_name` is empty) The flavor ID of   the desired flavor for the server. Changing this resizes the existing server.
    flavor_id = ""

    # flavor_name - (Optional) (Optional; Required if `flavor_id` is empty) The name of the   desired flavor for the server. Changing this resizes the existing server.
    flavor_name = ""

    # user_data - (Optional) The user data to provide when launching the instance.   Changing this creates a new server.
    user_data = ""

    # security_groups - (Optional) An array of one or more security group names   to associate with the server. Changing this results in adding/removing   security groups from the existing server. *Note*: When attaching the   instance to networks using Ports, place the security groups on the Port   and not the instance.
    security_groups = ""

    # availability_zone - (Optional) The availability zone in which to create   the server. Changing this creates a new server.
    availability_zone = ""

    # network - (Optional) An array of one or more networks to attach to the   instance. The network object structure is documented below. Changing this   creates a new server.
    network = ""

    # metadata - (Optional) Metadata key/value pairs to make available from   within the instance. Changing this updates the existing server metadata.
    metadata = ""

    # config_drive - (Optional) Whether to use the config_drive feature to   configure the instance. Changing this creates a new server.
    config_drive = ""

    # admin_pass - (Optional) The administrative password to assign to the server.   Changing this changes the root password on the existing server.
    admin_pass = ""

    # key_pair - (Optional) The name of a key pair to put on the server. The key   pair must already be created and associated with the tenant's account.   Changing this creates a new server.
    key_pair = ""

    # block_device - (Optional) Configuration of block devices. The block_device   structure is documented below. Changing this creates a new server.   You can specify multiple block devices which will create an instance with   multiple disks. This configuration is very flexible, so please see the   following [reference](http://docs.telefonicaopencloud.org/developer/nova/block_device_mapping.html)   for more information.
    block_device = ""

    # scheduler_hints - (Optional) Provide the Nova scheduler with hints on how   the instance should be launched. The available hints are described below.
    scheduler_hints = ""

    # personality - (Optional) Customize the personality of an instance by   defining one or more files and their contents. The personality structure   is described below.
    personality = ""

    # stop_before_destroy - (Optional) Whether to try stop instance gracefully   before destroying it, thus giving chance for guest OS daemons to stop correctly.   If instance doesn't stop within timeout, it will be destroyed anyway.
    stop_before_destroy = ""

    # uuid - (Optional) (Required unless `port`  or `name` is provided) The network UUID to   attach to the server. Changing this creates a new server.
    uuid = ""

    # name - (Optional) (Required unless `uuid` or `port` is provided) The human-readable   name of the network. Changing this creates a new server.
    name = ""

    # port - (Optional) (Required unless `uuid` or `name` is provided) The port UUID of a   network to attach to the server. Changing this creates a new server.
    port = ""

    # access_network - (Optional) Specifies if this network should be used for   provisioning access. Accepts true or false. Defaults to false.
    access_network = ""

    # uuid - (Optional) (Required unless `source_type` is set to `"blank"` ) The UUID of   the image, volume, or snapshot. Changing this creates a new server.
    uuid = ""

    # volume_size - (Optional) The size of the volume to create (in gigabytes). Required   in the following combinations: source=image and destination=volume,   source=blank and destination=local, and source=blank and destination=volume.   Changing this creates a new server.
    volume_size = ""

    # boot_index - (Optional) The boot index of the volume. It defaults to 0.   Changing this creates a new server.
    boot_index = ""

    # destination_type - (Optional) The type that gets created. Possible values   are "volume" and "local". Changing this creates a new server.
    destination_type = ""

    # delete_on_termination - (Optional) Delete the volume / block device upon   termination of the instance. Defaults to false. Changing this creates a   new server.
    delete_on_termination = ""

    # group - (Optional) A UUID of a Server Group. The instance will be placed   into that group.
    group = ""

    # different_host - (Optional) A list of instance UUIDs. The instance will   be scheduled on a different host than all other instances.
    different_host = ""

    # same_host - (Optional) A list of instance UUIDs. The instance will be   scheduled on the same host of those specified.
    same_host = ""

    # query - (Optional) A conditional query that a compute node must pass in   order to host an instance.
    query = ""

    # target_cell - (Optional) The name of a cell to host the instance.
    target_cell = ""

    # build_near_host_ip - (Optional) An IP Address in CIDR form. The instance   will be placed on a compute node that is in the same subnet.
    build_near_host_ip = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "access_ip_v4" - The first detected Fixed IPv4 address _or_ the
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "access_ip_v6" - The first detected Fixed IPv6 address.
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "metadata" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "security_groups" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "flavor_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "flavor_name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "network/uuid" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "network/name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "network/port" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "network/fixed_ip_v4" - The Fixed IPv4 address of the Instance on that
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "network/fixed_ip_v6" - The Fixed IPv6 address of the Instance on that
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "network/mac" - The MAC address of the NIC on that network.
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
    # "all_metadata" - Contains all instance metadata, even metadata not set
    # "contents" - (Required) The contents of the file. Limited to 255 bytes.
}

telefonicaopencloud-resource-compute-sec.body:
resource "telefonicaopencloud_compute_secgroup_v2" "$1" {
    # ip_protocol - (Required) The protocol type that will be allowed. Changing this creates a new security group rule.
    ip_protocol = ""

    # to_port - (Required) An integer representing the upper bound of the port range to open. Changing this creates a new security group rule.
    to_port = ""

    # from_port - (Required) An integer representing the lower bound of the port range to open. Changing this creates a new security group rule.
    from_port = ""

    # description - (Required) A description for the security group. Changing this   updates the `description` of an existing security group.
    description = ""

    # name - (Required) A unique name for the security group. Changing this   updates the `name` of an existing security group.
    name = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client.   A Compute client is needed to create a security group. If omitted, the   `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new   security group.
    region = ""

    # rule - (Optional) A rule describing how the security group operates. The   rule object structure is documented below. Changing this updates the   security group rules. As shown in the example above, multiple rule blocks   may be used.
    rule = ""

    # cidr - (Optional) Required if `from_group_id` or `self` is empty. The IP range that will be the source of network traffic to the security group. Use 0.0.0.0/0 to allow all IP addresses. Changing this creates a new security group rule. Cannot be combined with `from_group_id` or `self`.
    cidr = ""

    # from_group_id - (Optional) Required if `cidr` or `self` is empty. The ID of a group from which to forward traffic to the parent group. Changing this creates a new security group rule. Cannot be combined with `cidr` or `self`.
    from_group_id = ""

    # self - (Optional) Required if `cidr` and `from_group_id` is empty. If true, the security group itself will be added as a source to this ingress rule. Cannot be combined with `cidr` or `from_group_id`.
    self = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "self" - (Optional) Required if "cidr" and "from_group_id" is empty. If true, the security group itself will be added as a source to this ingress rule. Cannot be combined with "cidr" or "from_group_id".
    # "name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "self" - (Optional) Required if "cidr" and "from_group_id" is empty. If true, the security group itself will be added as a source to this ingress rule. Cannot be combined with "cidr" or "from_group_id".
    # "description" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "self" - (Optional) Required if "cidr" and "from_group_id" is empty. If true, the security group itself will be added as a source to this ingress rule. Cannot be combined with "cidr" or "from_group_id".
    # "rule" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "self" - (Optional) Required if "cidr" and "from_group_id" is empty. If true, the security group itself will be added as a source to this ingress rule. Cannot be combined with "cidr" or "from_group_id".
}

resource "telefonicaopencloud_compute_volume_attach_v2" "$1" {
    # volume_id - (Required) The ID of the Volume to attach to an Instance.
    volume_id = ""

    # instance_id - (Required) The ID of the Instance to attach the Volume to.
    instance_id = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Compute client.   A Compute client is needed to create a volume attachment. If omitted, the   `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a   new volume attachment.
    region = ""

    # device - (Optional) The device of the volume attachment (ex: `/dev/vdc`). _NOTE_: Being able to specify a device is dependent upon the hypervisor in use. There is a chance that the device specified in Terraform will not be the same device the hypervisor chose. If this happens, Terraform will wish to update the device upon subsequent applying which will cause the volume to be detached and reattached indefinitely. Please use with caution.
    device = ""

telefonicaopencloud-resource-elb-listene.body:
resource "telefonicaopencloud_elb_listener" "$1" {
    # lb_algorithm - (Required) Specifies the load balancing algorithm for the   listener. The value can be roundrobin, leastconn, or source.
    lb_algorithm = ""

    # backend_port - (Required) Specifies the backend port. The value ranges from   1 to 65535.
    backend_port = ""

    # backend_protocol - (Required) Specifies the backend protocol. If the value   of protocol is UDP, the value of this parameter can only be UDP. The value can   be HTTP, TCP, or UDP.
    backend_protocol = ""

    # port - (Required) Specifies the listening port. The value ranges from 1   to 65535.
    port = ""

    # protocol - (Required) Specifies the listening protocol used for layer 4   or 7. The value can be HTTP, TCP, HTTPS, or UDP.
    protocol = ""

    # loadbalancer_id - (Required) Specifies the ID of the load balancer to which   the listener belongs.
    loadbalancer_id = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the load balancer name. The name is a string   of 1 to 64 characters that consist of letters, digits, underscores (_), and   hyphens (-).
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) Provides supplementary information about the listener.   The value is a string of 0 to 128 characters and cannot be <>.
    description = ""

    # session_sticky - (Optional) Specifies whether to enable sticky session.   The value can be true or false. The Sticky session is enabled when the value   is true, and is disabled when the value is false. If the value of protocol is   HTTP, HTTPS, or TCP, and the value of lb_algorithm is not roundrobin, the value   of this parameter can only be false.
    session_sticky = ""

    # sticky_session_type - (Optional) Specifies the cookie processing method.   The value is insert. insert indicates that the cookie is inserted by the load   balancer. This parameter is valid when protocol is set to HTTP, and session_sticky   to true. The default value is insert. This parameter is invalid when protocol   is set to TCP or UDP, which means the parameter is empty.
    sticky_session_type = ""

    # cookie_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the cookie timeout period (minutes).   This parameter is valid when protocol is set to HTTP, session_sticky to true,   and sticky_session_type to insert. This parameter is invalid when protocol is   set to TCP or UDP. The value ranges from 1 to 1440.
    cookie_timeout = ""

    # tcp_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the TCP timeout period (minutes). This   parameter is valid when protocol is set to TCP. The value ranges from 1 to 5.
    tcp_timeout = ""

    # tcp_draining - (Optional) Specifies whether to maintain the TCP connection   to the backend ECS after the ECS is deleted. This parameter is valid when protocol   is set to TCP. The value can be true or false.
    tcp_draining = ""

    # tcp_draining_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the timeout duration (minutes)   for the TCP connection to the backend ECS after the ECS is deleted. This parameter   is valid when protocol is set to TCP, and tcp_draining to true. The value ranges   from 0 to 60.
    tcp_draining_timeout = ""

    # certificate_id - (Optional) Specifies the ID of the SSL certificate used   for security authentication when HTTPS is used to make API calls. This parameter   is mandatory if the value of protocol is HTTPS. The value can be obtained by   viewing the details of the SSL certificate.
    certificate_id = ""

    # udp_timeout - (Optional) Specifies the UDP timeout duration (minutes). This   parameter is valid when protocol is set to UDP. The value ranges from 1 to 1440.
    udp_timeout = ""

    # ssl_protocols - (Optional) Specifies the SSL protocol standard supported   by a tracker, which is used for enabling specified encryption protocols. This   parameter is valid only when the value of protocol is set to HTTPS. The value   is TLSv1.2 or TLSv1.2 TLSv1.1 TLSv1. The default value is TLSv1.2.
    ssl_protocols = ""

    # ssl_ciphers - (Optional) Specifies the cipher suite of an encryption protocol.   This parameter is valid only when the value of protocol is set to HTTPS. The   value is Default, Extended, or Strict. The default value is Default. The value   can only be set to Extended if the value of ssl_protocols is set to TLSv1.2   TLSv1.1 TLSv1.
    ssl_ciphers = ""

The   value is Default, Extended, or Strict. The default value is Default. The value   can only be set to Extended if the value of ssl_protocols is set to TLSv1.2   TLSv1.1 TLSv1.
    # "description" - See Argument Reference above.

The   value is Default, Extended, or Strict. The default value is Default. The value   can only be set to Extended if the value of ssl_protocols is set to TLSv1.2   TLSv1.1 TLSv1.
    # "loadbalancer_id" - See Argument Reference above.

The   value is Default, Extended, or Strict. The default value is Default. The value   can only be set to Extended if the value of ssl_protocols is set to TLSv1.2   TLSv1.1 TLSv1.
    # "protocol" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "ssl_ciphers" - (Optional) Specifies the cipher suite of an encryption protocol.   This parameter is valid only when the value of protocol is set to HTTPS. The   value is Default, Extended, or Strict. The default value is Default. The value   can only be set to Extended if the value of ssl_protocols is set to TLSv1.2   TLSv1.1 TLSv1.
    # "port" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "ssl_ciphers" - (Optional) Specifies the cipher suite of an encryption protocol.   This parameter is valid only when the value of protocol is set to HTTPS. telefonicaopencloud-resource-elb-loadbal.body:
resource "telefonicaopencloud_elb_loadbalancer" "$1" {
    # admin_state_up - (Required) Specifies the status of the load balancer.   Value range: 0 or false: indicates that the load balancer is stopped. Only   tenants are allowed to enter these two values. 1 or true: indicates that   the load balancer is running properly. 2 or false: indicates that the load   balancer is frozen. Only tenants are allowed to enter these two values.
    admin_state_up = ""

    # type - (Required) Specifies the load balancer type. The value can be   Internal or External.
    type = ""

    # vpc_id - (Required) Specifies the VPC ID.
    vpc_id = ""

    # name - (Required) Specifies the load balancer name. The name is a string   of 1 to 64 characters that consist of letters, digits, underscores (_),   and hyphens (-).
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) Provides supplementary information about the   listener. The value is a string of 0 to 128 characters and cannot be <>.
    description = ""

    # bandwidth - (Optional) Specifies the bandwidth (Mbit/s). This parameter   is mandatory when type is set to External, and it is invalid when type   is set to Internal. The value ranges from 1 to 300.
    bandwidth = ""

resource "telefonicaopencloud_networking_floatingip_v2" "$1" {
    # pool - (Required) The name of the pool from which to obtain the floating   IP. Changing this creates a new floating IP.
    pool = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.   A Networking client is needed to create a floating IP that can be used with   another networking resource, such as a load balancer. If omitted, the   `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new   floating IP (which may or may not have a different address).
    region = ""

    # port_id - (Optional) ID of an existing port with at least one IP address to   associate with this floating IP.
    port_id = ""

    # tenant_id - (Optional) The target tenant ID in which to allocate the floating   IP, if you specify this together with a port_id, make sure the target port   belongs to the same tenant. Changing this creates a new floating IP (which   may or may not have a different address)
    tenant_id = ""

    # fixed_ip - (Optional) Fixed IP of the port to associate with this floating IP. Required if the port has multiple fixed IPs.
    fixed_ip = ""

    # value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.
    value_specs = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "value_specs" - (Optional) Map of additional options.
    # "pool" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "value_specs" - (Optional) Map of additional options.
    # "address" - The actual floating IP address itself.
    # "value_specs" - (Optional) Map of additional options.
    # "port_id" - ID of associated port.
    # "value_specs" - (Optional) Map of additional options.
    # "tenant_id" - the ID of the tenant in which to create the floating IP.
    # "value_specs" - (Optional) Map of additional options.
    # "fixed_ip" - The fixed IP which the floating IP maps to.
    # "value_specs" - (Optional) Map of additional options.
}
telefonicaopencloud-resource-networking-.description:
Manages a V2 floating IP resource within TelefonicaOpenCloud Neutron (networking)
that can be used for load balancers.
These are similar to Nova (compute) floating IP resources,
but only compute floating IPs can be used with compute instances.

    distributed = ""

Manages a V2 neutron security group rule resource within TelefonicaOpenCloud.
Unlike Nova security groups, neutron separates the group from the rules
and also allows an admin to target a specific tenant_id.

telefonicaopencloud-resource-networking-.body:
resource "telefonicaopencloud_networking_subnet_v2" "$1" {
    # next_hop - (Required) The next hop in the route.
    next_hop = ""

    # destination_cidr - (Required) The destination CIDR.
    destination_cidr = ""

    # end - (Required) The ending address.
    end = ""

    # start - (Required) The starting address.
    start = ""

    # cidr - (Required) CIDR representing IP range for this subnet, based on IP   version. Changing this creates a new subnet.
    cidr = ""

    # network_id - (Required) The UUID of the parent network. Changing this   creates a new subnet.
    network_id = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which to obtain the V2 Networking client.   A Networking client is needed to create a Neutron subnet. If omitted, the   `region` argument of the provider is used. Changing this creates a new   subnet.
    region = ""

    # ip_version - (Optional) IP version, either 4 (default) or 6. Changing this creates a   new subnet.
    ip_version = ""

    # name - (Optional) The name of the subnet. Changing this updates the name of   the existing subnet.
    name = ""

    # tenant_id - (Optional) The owner of the subnet. Required if admin wants to   create a subnet for another tenant. Changing this creates a new subnet.
    tenant_id = ""

    # allocation_pools - (Optional) An array of sub-ranges of CIDR available for   dynamic allocation to ports. The allocation_pool object structure is   documented below. Changing this creates a new subnet.
    allocation_pools = ""

    # gateway_ip - (Optional)  Default gateway used by devices in this subnet.   Leaving this blank and not setting `no_gateway` will cause a default   gateway of `.1` to be used. Changing this updates the gateway IP of the   existing subnet.
    gateway_ip = ""

    # no_gateway - (Optional) Do not set a gateway IP on this subnet. Changing   this removes or adds a default gateway IP of the existing subnet.
    no_gateway = ""

    # enable_dhcp - (Optional) The administrative state of the network.   Acceptable values are "true" and "false". Changing this value enables or   disables the DHCP capabilities of the existing subnet. Defaults to true.
    enable_dhcp = ""

    # dns_nameservers - (Optional) An array of DNS name server names used by hosts   in this subnet. Changing this updates the DNS name servers for the existing   subnet.
    dns_nameservers = ""

    # host_routes - (Optional) An array of routes that should be used by devices   with IPs from this subnet (not including local subnet route). The host_route   object structure is documented below. Changing this updates the host routes   for the existing subnet.
    host_routes = ""

    # value_specs - (Optional) Map of additional options.
    value_specs = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "next_hop" - (Required) The next hop in the route.
    # "network_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "next_hop" - (Required) The next hop in the route.
    # "cidr" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "next_hop" - (Required) The next hop in the route.
    # "ip_version" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "next_hop" - (Required) The next hop in the route.
    # "name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "next_hop" - (Required) The next hop in the route.
    # "tenant_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "next_hop" - (Required) The next hop in the route.
    # "allocation_pools" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "next_hop" - (Required) The next hop in the route.
    # "gateway_ip" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "next_hop" - (Required) The next hop in the route.
    # "enable_dhcp" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "next_hop" - (Required) The next hop in the route.
    # "dns_nameservers" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "next_hop" - (Required) The next hop in the route.
    # "host_routes" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "next_hop" - (Required) The next hop in the route.
}

telefonicaopencloud-resource-s3-bucket.body:
resource "telefonicaopencloud_s3_bucket" "$1" {
    # bucket - (Required) The ARN of the S3 bucket where you want Amazon S3 to store replicas of the object identified by the rule.
    bucket = ""

    # status - (Required) The status of the rule. Either `Enabled` or `Disabled`. The rule is ignored if status is not Enabled.
    status = ""

    # prefix - (Required) Object keyname prefix identifying one or more objects to which the rule applies. Set as an empty string to replicate the whole bucket.
    prefix = ""

    # destination - (Required) Specifies the destination for the rule (documented below).
    destination = ""

    # days - (Required) Specifies the number of days an object is noncurrent object versions expire.
    days = ""

    # enabled - (Required) Specifies lifecycle rule status.
    enabled = ""

    # target_bucket - (Required) The name of the bucket that will receive the log objects.
    target_bucket = ""

    # allowed_origins - (Required) Specifies which origins are allowed.
    allowed_origins = ""

    # allowed_methods - (Required) Specifies which methods are allowed. Can be `GET`, `PUT`, `POST`, `DELETE` or `HEAD`.
    allowed_methods = ""

    # bucket - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) The name of the bucket. If omitted, Terraform will assign a random, unique name.
    bucket = ""

    # bucket_prefix - (Optional) (Optional, Forces new resource) Creates a unique bucket name beginning with the specified prefix. Conflicts with `bucket`.
    bucket_prefix = ""

    # acl - (Optional) The [canned ACL](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/acl-overview.html#canned-acl) to apply. Defaults to "private".
    acl = ""

    # policy - (Optional) A valid [bucket policy](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/example-bucket-policies.html) JSON document. Note that if the policy document is not specific enough (but still valid), Terraform may view the policy as constantly changing in a `terraform plan`. In this case, please make sure you use the verbose/specific version of the policy.
    policy = ""

    # force_destroy - (Optional) (Optional, Default:false ) A boolean that indicates all objects should be deleted from the bucket so that the bucket can be destroyed without error. These objects are *not* recoverable.
    force_destroy = ""

    # website - (Optional) A website object (documented below).
    website = ""

    # cors_rule - (Optional) A rule of [Cross-Origin Resource Sharing](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/cors.html) (documented below).
    cors_rule = ""

    # versioning - (Optional) A state of [versioning](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/Versioning.html) (documented below)
    versioning = ""

    # logging - (Optional) A settings of [bucket logging](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/UG/ManagingBucketLogging.html) (documented below).
    logging = ""

    # lifecycle_rule - (Optional) A configuration of [object lifecycle management](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/object-lifecycle-mgmt.html) (documented below).
    lifecycle_rule = ""

    # region - (Optional) If specified, the AWS region this bucket should reside in. Otherwise, the region used by the callee.
    region = ""

    # index_document - (Optional) (Required, unless using `redirect_all_requests_to`) Amazon S3 returns this index document when requests are made to the root domain or any of the subfolders.
    index_document = ""

    # error_document - (Optional) An absolute path to the document to return in case of a 4XX error.
    error_document = ""

    # redirect_all_requests_to - (Optional) A hostname to redirect all website requests for this bucket to. Hostname can optionally be prefixed with a protocol (`http://` or `https://`) to use when redirecting requests. The default is the protocol that is used in the original request.
    redirect_all_requests_to = ""

    # routing_rules - (Optional) A json array containing [routing rules](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/aws-properties-s3-websiteconfiguration-routingrules.html)
    routing_rules = ""

    # allowed_headers - (Optional) Specifies which headers are allowed.
    allowed_headers = ""

    # expose_headers - (Optional) Specifies expose header in the response.
    expose_headers = ""

    # max_age_seconds - (Optional) Specifies time in seconds that browser can cache the response for a preflight request.
    max_age_seconds = ""

    # enabled - (Optional) Enable versioning. Once you version-enable a bucket, it can never return to an unversioned state. You can, however, suspend versioning on that bucket.
    enabled = ""

    # mfa_delete - (Optional) Enable MFA delete for either `Change the versioning state of your bucket` or `Permanently delete an object version`. Default is `false`.
    mfa_delete = ""

    # target_prefix - (Optional) To specify a key prefix for log objects.
    target_prefix = ""

    # id - (Optional) Unique identifier for the rule.
    id = ""

    # prefix - (Optional) Object key prefix identifying one or more objects to which the rule applies.
    prefix = ""

    # abort_incomplete_multipart_upload_days - (Optional) Specifies the number of days after initiating a multipart upload when the multipart upload must be completed.
    abort_incomplete_multipart_upload_days = ""

    # expiration - (Optional) Specifies a period in the object's expire (documented below).
    expiration = ""

    # noncurrent_version_expiration - (Optional) Specifies when noncurrent object versions expire (documented below).
    noncurrent_version_expiration = ""

    # date - (Optional) Specifies the date after which you want the corresponding action to take effect.
    date = ""

    # days - (Optional) Specifies the number of days after object creation when the specific rule action takes effect.
    days = ""

    # expired_object_delete_marker - (Optional) On a versioned bucket (versioning-enabled or versioning-suspended bucket), you can add this element in the lifecycle configuration to direct Amazon S3 to delete expired object delete markers.
    expired_object_delete_marker = ""

    # id - (Optional) Unique identifier for the rule.
    id = ""

    # storage_class - (Optional) The class of storage used to store the object.
    storage_class = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The name of the bucket.
    # "arn" - The ARN of the bucket. Will be of format "arn:aws:s3:::bucketname".
    # "bucket_domain_name" - The bucket domain name. Will be of format "bucketname.s3.amazonaws.com".
    # "hosted_zone_id" - The [Route 53 Hosted Zone ID](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#s3_website_region_endpoints) for this bucket's region.
    # "region" - The AWS region this bucket resides in.
    # "website_endpoint" - The website endpoint, if the bucket is configured with a website. If not, this will be an empty string.
    # "website_domain" - The domain of the website endpoint, if the bucket is configured with a website. If not, this will be an empty string. This is used to create Route 53 alias records.
}

telefonicaopencloud-resource-s3-bucket-o.body:
resource "telefonicaopencloud_s3_bucket_object" "$1" {
    # source - (Required) The path to the source file being uploaded to the bucket.
    source = ""

    # key - (Required) The name of the object once it is in the bucket.
    key = ""

    # bucket - (Required) The name of the bucket to put the file in.
    bucket = ""

    # content - (Optional) (Required unless `source` given) The literal content being uploaded to the bucket.
    content = ""

    # acl - (Optional) The [canned ACL](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/acl-overview.html#canned-acl) to apply. Defaults to "private".
    acl = ""

    # cache_control - (Optional) Specifies caching behavior along the request/reply chain Read [w3c cache_control](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.9) for further details.
    cache_control = ""

    # content_disposition - (Optional) Specifies presentational information for the object. Read [wc3 content_disposition](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec19.html#sec19.5.1) for further information.
    content_disposition = ""

    # content_encoding - (Optional) Specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object and thus what decoding mechanisms must be applied to obtain the media-type referenced by the Content-Type header field. Read [w3c content encoding](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.11) for further information.
    content_encoding = ""

    # content_language - (Optional) The language the content is in e.g. en-US or en-GB.
    content_language = ""

    # content_type - (Optional) A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data, e.g. application/octet-stream. All Valid MIME Types are valid for this input.
    content_type = ""

    # website_redirect - (Optional) Specifies a target URL for [website redirect](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/how-to-page-redirect.html).
    website_redirect = ""

    # etag - (Optional) Used to trigger updates. The only meaningful value is `${md5(file("path/to/file"))}`.
    etag = ""

    # server_side_encryption - (Optional) Specifies server-side encryption of the object in S3. Valid values are "`AES256`" and "`aws:kms`".
    server_side_encryption = ""

    # sse_kms_key_id - (Optional) The ID of the kms key.
    sse_kms_key_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - the "key" of the resource supplied above
    # "etag" - the ETag generated for the object (an MD5 sum of the object content).
    # "version_id" - A unique version ID value for the object, if bucket versioning
}

telefonicaopencloud-resource-vpc-eip-v1.body:

    # charge_type - (Required) Whether the bandwidth is shared or exclusive. Changing   this creates a new eip.
    charge_type = ""

    # size - (Required) The bandwidth size. The value ranges from 1 to 300 Mbit/s.
    size = ""

    # name - (Required) The bandwidth name, which is a string of 1 to 64 characters   that contain letters, digits, underscores (_), and hyphens (-).
    name = ""

    # type - (Required) The value must be a type supported by the system. Only   `5_bgp` supported now. Changing this creates a new eip.

    bandwidth = ""

    ip_address = ""

    # port_id - (Optional) The port id which this eip will associate with. If the value   is "" or this not specified, the eip will be in unbind state.
    port_id = ""

    # charge_mode - (Optional) This is a reserved field. If the system supports charging   by traffic and this field is specified, then you are charged by traffic for elastic   IP addresses. Changing this creates a new eip.
    charge_mode = ""
